definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)
canon/law/standard work of scholarship/literary quotation or allusion/ceremony/to be in charge of/to mortgage or pawn
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: Traditionally, eight people carry in the flag at the Opening Ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 傳統上，在開幕典禮上會有八個人運送旗幟進入會場。

sentences.english: They flew there in order that they might be in time to attend the opening ceremony .
sentences.chinese: 他們飛往那裏以便能及時參加開幕典禮。

sentences.english: She will also attend the opening ceremony of Singapore International Water Week 2009 on June 22.
sentences.chinese: 並出席新加坡2009國際水資源周的開幕典禮。

sentences.english: Opening Ceremony was successfully held after the round trip of lion performance at the exhibition hall .
sentences.chinese: 開幕典禮在醒獅帶領與會者到展覽館繞場一週後完成。

sentences.english: The President will open the new heliport tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 明天總統將主持新直升機機場的開幕典禮。

sentences.english: In his Asian tour this time, his first stop will be singing at the opening ceremony of the Shanghai World Expo.
sentences.chinese: 此次亞洲演出，他首站先到上海世博開幕典禮開唱。

sentences.english: They flew there in order that they might be in time to attend the opening ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 他們飛往那裏以便能及時參加開幕典禮。

sentences.english: Certificate of Appreciation will be presented during Grand Opening of the new building.
sentences.chinese: 將會在新校舍開幕典禮上獲得頒發證書，以示感激。

sentences.english: The pinnacle of the celebration programme was the Lantau Link Opening Ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 慶祝活動的高潮是青嶼幹線開幕典禮。

sentences.english: The Queen will visit the town in May when she will open the new hospital.
sentences.chinese: 屆時她將一所新醫院的開幕典禮。

sentences.english: Is he coming to the inauguration ceremony?

definition: the curtain falls/lower the curtain/to come to an end (of a meeting)
to make a speech/to make some remarks
to arrive (esp. of notable person)/to visit (more formal than 光臨|光临[guang1 lin2])
